original: Your dreams might show you all kinds of insights into things that you didn't realise you were thinking about. Common dreams like being able to fly or falling, your teeth falling out or having no clothes on in a public place probably mean something similar in most people. But the key to understanding exactly what they mean to you is to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.
simplified:
Your dreams can show you many things.
They show you what you are thinking about.
Sometimes you do not know you think about these things.

Some dreams are very common.
For example, you dream you can fly or you are falling.
Or you dream your teeth fall out.
Or you have no clothes in a public place.
These dreams often mean a similar thing for most people.

But you need to understand your own dream.
To do this, think about your daily life.
Think about what happens and how you feel.

simplified: Your dreams might show you ideas about things that you didn't realise you were thinking about. Although common dreams like flying, falling, your teeth falling out, or being without clothes in a public place probably mean something similar for most people, the best way to understand what they mean to you is to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.

original: One of the most interesting cases of wild animals living in a city are the wild dogs of Moscow. In Moscow, there are approximately 35,000 wild dogs living on the streets. Some of the dogs were born wild, while others are pets that have been abandoned by their owners. Some dogs live alone and others live in packs. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that the dogs have adapted remarkably successfully to urban life. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people and some dogs appear to understand traffic lights.
simplified:
In the city of Moscow, there are many wild dogs.
They live on the streets.
There are about 35,000 dogs.
Some dogs were born on the streets.
Other dogs were pets, but their owners left them.
Some dogs live alone and other dogs live in groups.
In 2010, scientists studied the dogs.
They learned that the dogs live very well in the city.
The dogs learned it is safer to cross the street with people.
Some dogs also seem to understand traffic lights.

In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that the dogs have adapted remarkably successfully to urban life. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people and some dogs appear to understand traffic lights.
simplified: An interesting example of wild animals living in a city is the wild dogs of Moscow, where there are about 35,000 of them on the streets. Some of these dogs were born wild, while others are pets that their owners have left behind. The dogs sometimes live alone and sometimes in groups. In 2010, scientists who studied the dogs found that they have adapted very successfully to city life. For example, they have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people, and some dogs even seem to understand traffic lights.

original: Wonder is New Yorker RJ Palacio's first novel. On her website, she explains that the idea for the book came to her after seeing a girl with facial deformities on the street one day. Wonder has been a bestseller in the United States and has already won several awards. Many schools are using it as a starting point for discussions about bullying, friendship and what it's like to be different. A film version is being made, and many, including me, are waiting eagerly to see what RJ Palacio writes next.
simplified:
"Wonder" is a novel by RJ Palacio. She is from New York. It is her first novel.

One day, she saw a girl on the street. The girl's face was not formed in the usual way. This gave her the idea for the novel.

The novel is a bestseller in the United States. A bestseller is a book that many people buy. It also won many awards.

Bullying is when someone is not nice to another person again and again. Many schools use the novel. They use it to talk about bullying. They also talk about friends and what happens when you are different.

People are making a movie of the novel. RJ Palacio will write a new book. Many people are very excited and are waiting for it.

Many schools are using it as a starting point for discussions about bullying, friendship and what it's like to be different. simplified: *Wonder* is the first novel by RJ Palacio, who is from New York. On her website, she explains that the idea for the book came to her one day after she saw a girl who had a condition that affected her face. The book has been a bestseller in the United States and has already won several awards. Many schools are using it to start discussions about topics like bullying, friendship and what it feels like to be different. A film version is also being made, and many people are waiting eagerly to see what RJ Palacio will write next.

original: Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows they're not typical pets and she has lost count of the times she's patiently tried to explain to people that rats aren't dirty and they make fantastic pets if you look after them correctly. But she understands why people react badly. She didn't like rats either until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how affectionate and intelligent they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she'd like to have two of them.
simplified:
Chloe has two pet rats. Their names are Zena and Roxy.
Chloe knows that rats are not normal pets. Many people think rats are dirty. Chloe often explains that this is not true. She says rats are fantastic pets if you look after them well.
But she understands why people do not like them. She did not like rats before. Then her friend Martin showed her his pet rats. She saw they were friendly and smart.
Last year, one of Martin's rats had babies. Chloe decided she wanted to have two of them.

However, she understands why people react badly, because she did not like rats either until her friend Martin showed her his own pets and she saw how affectionate and intelligent they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she wanted to have two of them.

original: Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. Some have been injured or killed in car accidents and others have been electrocuted as they played with electric cables. Baboons are an endangered species and to save them and minimise conflicts between humans and baboons, the city council has employed a team of Baboon Monitors. The monitors' job is to chase baboons out of urban areas or catch them and release them in the countryside. This policy has had some success, though it is proving hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a source of easy food.
simplified:
Baboons are a type of big monkey.
Cape Town can be a dangerous place for them.
Sometimes, cars hurt or kill the baboons.
Other times, they play with electric cables.
They get hurt by the electricity.
There are not many baboons in the world, and they are in danger.
To save the baboons and stop problems between people, the city has a team to help.
Their job is to chase baboons out of the city.
Sometimes they catch the baboons.
Then they take them to the countryside and let them go.
This plan helps a little.
But it is hard to stop the baboons from coming back.
They come back to the city.
This is because they find easy food there.

The monitors' job is to chase baboons out of urban areas or catch them and release them in the countryside. This policy has had some success, though it is proving hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a source of easy food.
simplified: Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons because some have been injured or killed in car accidents, and others have been hurt by electricity when they played with electric cables. Baboons are an endangered species, so to save them and reduce problems between humans and baboons, the city council has hired a team of Baboon Monitors. Monitors are people whose job is to chase baboons out of city areas, or to catch them and release them in the countryside. This plan has had some success, although it is difficult to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a place where they can easily find food.

original: I work for a global IT company, but because their headquarters is in the States, I do all my work online from home. That means that I don't waste time commuting or making idle chit-chat with colleagues. I work on a project basis, and this flexibility is very valuable to me because it means that I can easily take some time off when my children need me to go to their school performances or if I need to schedule an appointment with the dentist. The downside is that without clear office hours, I tend to work well into the evening, sometimes skipping dinner to finish a task.
simplified:
I work for a big IT company. The company's main office is in the USA. So I do all my work at home online.

This is good for me. I do not lose time travelling to work. I do not make small talk with people at the office. I work on different projects. So I can choose when I work. This is very important to me. I can easily take time off. I can go to my children's school shows. Or I can make a time to see the dentist.

But there is a bad side. I do not have clear work hours. I often work late in the evening. Sometimes I do not eat dinner. This is because I need to finish a job.

This means that I don't waste time travelling to work or having unimportant conversations with my colleagues. I work on different projects, and this freedom is very important to me because it means I can easily take time off when my children have school performances or if I need to make an appointment with the dentist. The disadvantage is that I don't have fixed working hours, so I often work late into the evening and sometimes miss dinner to finish a task.

original: In the 1990s, graffiti continued but there was also an explosion in street art around the world. Some artists wanted to make political points and produced art that tried to make people think about war, inequality and discrimination. Other street artists were more concerned with producing beautiful, attractive work. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas adding colour, life and beauty to grey, city walls.
simplified:
In the 1990s, there was still graffiti. But street art grew very quickly. It became very popular all over the world.

Some artists wanted to make political points. Their art made people think about big problems. These problems were war, or when life is not fair for everyone. Other artists were different. They just wanted to make beautiful art. They wanted their work to look nice.

In South America, many artists worked in poor places. The city walls there were grey. The artists added colour and life to the walls. They made the walls beautiful.

original: In the 1990s, graffiti continued but there was also an explosion in street art around the world. Some artists wanted to make political points and produced art that tried to make people think about war, inequality and discrimination. Other street artists were more concerned with producing beautiful, attractive work. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas adding colour, life and beauty to grey, city walls.
simplified: In the 1990s, **graffiti**, which is a type of writing or drawing on walls, continued, but there was also a big increase in **street art**, a type of art that is created in public places, around the world. Some artists wanted to make political points, so they produced art that tried to make people think about serious problems like war, or situations where people were treated unfairly. However, other street artists were more interested in producing beautiful and attractive work. In South America, for example, many of these artists went to work in poor areas, where they added colour, life, and beauty to grey city walls.

original: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people daily with things to buy, and British consumers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping means it is easy for customers to buy without thinking, while major brands offer such cheap clothes that they can be treated like disposable items – worn two or three times and then thrown away.
simplified:
People see things to buy every day. They see them on social media, in magazines and in shops. So, people in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes now.

It is easy to buy things online. People can buy things without thinking. Big companies also offer very cheap clothes. So people use them like things you use once. They wear them two or three times. Then they throw them away.

original: Social media, magazines and shop windows bombard people daily with things to buy, and British consumers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. simplified: Every day, social media, magazines and shop windows are full of things to buy, so British people are now buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping makes it easy for people to buy things without thinking, while big companies offer clothes that are so cheap they can be treated like items you throw away, which are worn only two or three times and then put in the bin.

original: Sam squinted against the sun at the distant dust trail raked up by the car on its way up to the Big House. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, not caring about their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter didn't come out here unless he had to, which was just fine by Sam. The more he kept out of his boss's way, the longer he'd have a job. Mr, Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The damp patches on his shirt drew together like shapes in an atlas. His skin was already turning ruddy in the June sun. Otherwise he had the indoor tan of a man that made money while other people did the work.
simplified:
The sun was bright. Sam closed his eyes a little. He looked at a car far away. The car made the dirt go up into the air. It was going to the Big House.

The horses moved their tails. They did not care about their owner. This was his first visit in ten months.

Sam waited. Mr Carter was his boss. Mr Carter only came here when it was important. Sam was happy about this. He knew he could keep his job if he stayed away from his boss.

Mr Carter was hot. He cleaned the sweat from his neck. His shirt was wet in some parts. The wet parts looked like maps. His skin was getting red in the June sun. But his skin was not dark. He was a man with money. Other people did the work for him.

His skin was already turning ruddy in the June sun. Otherwise he had the indoor tan of a man that made money while other people did the work.
simplified: Sam looked towards the sun at the distant cloud of dust which the car was making on its way to the Big House. The horses kicked and moved their tails because of the flies. They did not seem to care that this was their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter only came out here when he had to. This was fine with Sam, as he knew that if he avoided his boss, he would keep his job for longer. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck, and the wet spots on his shirt joined together like shapes on a map. His skin was already turning red in the June sun. Usually, he had the skin colour of a man who made money while other people did the work.

original: Many city residents in Berlin, Germany complained that shooting pigs was unnecessarily cruel and there were heated arguments between hunters and animal lovers. In response to protests, the city council decided to take more peaceful action against pigs. Instead of shooting them, they have put up fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs. Time will tell if this strategy works, though it may be a losing battle as warmer winters mean that pig numbers are greater than in the past.
simplified:
Many people in Berlin were not happy. They said killing wild pigs with guns was wrong. They said it hurt the animals too much. Because of this, some people had angry arguments. Then, many people protested.

Because people protested, the city government made a new plan. It was a more peaceful plan. They stopped killing the pigs with guns. Instead, they put up fences. They also made a new rule. The rule says people cannot feed the pigs.

We do not know if this new plan will work. The city may lose this fight. This is because the winters are warmer now. Warmer winters mean there are more pigs than before.

Time will tell if this strategy works, though it may be a losing battle as warmer winters mean that pig numbers are greater than in the past.
simplified: Many people in Berlin, Germany, complained that shooting pigs was too cruel, and there were angry discussions between hunters and animal lovers. As a result of these complaints, the city's government decided to use a more peaceful method against the pigs. Instead of shooting them, they have built fences and have also made it illegal for people to feed them. We will see in the future if this plan works, although it might be a fight they lose. This is because warmer winters mean that the number of pigs is higher than it was in the past.

original: An important inspiration for the Hunger Games book comes from Suzanne's love of classical Greek mythology. When she was a child, one of her favourite stories was Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story the city of Athens is ruled by Crete, but the Athenians rebel. As a punishment, Minos the king of Crete forces the Athenians to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. The youths are thrown into the labyrinth and eaten by a monster that lives there called the Minotaur. But one of the youths, named Theseus, fights the Minotaur and kills it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a futuristic Theseus.
simplified:
An important inspiration for the Hunger Games book came from old Greek stories. Suzanne loved these stories when she was a child. One of her favourite stories was about a man named Theseus.

In this story, the king of Crete ruled the city of Athens. But the people of Athens fought back. The king punished them. Every year, Athens had to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete.

They put these young people in a big maze. A monster lived there. The monster's name was the Minotaur. The Minotaur ate the young people.

But one young man was named Theseus. He fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne thinks Katniss Everdeen is like a Theseus from the future.

Suzanne Collins sees Katniss Everdeen as a version of Theseus from the future.

original: By bringing people and animals together, zoos have the potential to educate the public about conservation issues and inspire people to protect animals and their habitats. Some zoos provide a safe environment for animals which have been mistreated in circuses, or pets which have been abandoned. Zoos also carry out important research into subjects like animal behaviour and how to treat illnesses.
simplified:
Zoos bring people and animals together.
They can teach people why it is important to protect animals.
This can make people want to help animals and their homes.
Some zoos give a safe home to animals.
These animals were treated badly in circuses.
Or they were pets that people did not want anymore.
Zoos also do important research.
They study how animals act and learn how to help sick animals.

Zoos also do important research on topics like how animals behave and how to treat their illnesses.

original: A different trend is springing up in opposition to consumerism – the 'buy nothing' trend. The idea originated in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US, where it became a rejection of the overspending and overconsumption of Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day people organise various types of protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups organise the exchange and repair of items they already own.
simplified:
Consumerism is the idea that it is good to buy many things. But a new idea is starting. It is the opposite of consumerism. This new idea is called 'buy nothing'.

This idea started in Canada in the 1990s. Then it moved to the US. In the US, people buy too many things on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. The 'buy nothing' idea was a movement against buying too much.

There is a special day called 'Buy Nothing Day'. On this day, people join protests against buying too much. Some people cut up their credit cards.

All year, there are 'Buy Nothing' groups. These groups help people share things. They also help people fix things they already have.

On Buy Nothing Day people organise various types of protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups organise the exchange and repair of items they already own.
simplified: A different trend called 'buy nothing' is growing against consumerism, which is the idea that it is good to buy a lot of things. The idea started in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US, where it became a protest against spending too much money and buying too many things on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On Buy Nothing Day, people organise different kinds of protests and sometimes cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups also help people to exchange and repair things that they already own.

original: Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on your point of view, but in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police and some have had to pay fines. Many city councils complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti off buildings, buses and trains.
simplified: Graffiti is pictures or writing on walls. Is graffiti art? This depends on your point of view. But in many countries, the law says it is vandalism. Vandalism is a crime. Someone paints on a building. The building is not theirs. People paint on public buildings. They also paint on buildings that people own. The police stop many street artists. Some artists have to pay fines. Many city leaders complain about the cost. They say it costs a lot of money to clean the graffiti. They clean it from buildings, buses and trains.

original: Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on your point of view, but in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police and some have had to pay fines. Many city councils complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti off buildings, buses and trains.
simplified: Graffiti is writing or pictures painted on walls and buildings, and people often ask if it is art or vandalism. Vandalism is the crime of breaking property that doesn't belong to you. The answer depends on your opinion, but in many countries, it is considered vandalism when people write or paint on public or private property. Because of this, many street artists have been caught by the police, and some have had to pay money as a punishment. In addition, city governments often complain about how much it costs to clean the graffiti from buildings, buses and trains.

original: What does the art world think of graffiti and street art? Recently, there has been a growing recognition of its value as an art form. There have been major exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles. The American artist Elura Emerald organised a street art exhibition at a New York gallery in 2008. She defended street artists, saying 'artists who paint on the street are merely expressing themselves, not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated'.
simplified:
Graffiti is when people write or draw on walls in public places. Street art is art that people make in public places, like on streets.

What do people in the art world think about it? Now, many people think it is a real type of art. There were big art shows in Paris, London and Los Angeles. People could see street art in special art places called galleries.

Elura Emerald is an American artist. In 2008, she made a street art show in New York. She said good things about street artists. She said they just want to show their ideas. They do not hurt anyone. She said people should like their art.

She defended street artists, saying 'artists who paint on the street are merely expressing themselves, not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated'.
simplified: What does the art world think of **graffiti** and **street art**, which are types of art created in public places? Recently, people have started to understand its value as an art form, and there have been major exhibitions in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles. For example, the American artist Elura Emerald organised a street art exhibition in a New York gallery in 2008. She supported street artists. She said that artists who paint on the street are just expressing themselves and not hurting anyone. She also said that they should be appreciated and celebrated.

original: If most people have four to six dreams every night after the age of ten, that's as many as 2,000 dreams per year. So, by the time they reach 80 years old the average person might have had 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95–99 per cent of our dreams, that's still a few thousand remembered dreams across a lifetime. It's not too difficult to believe that, by coincidence, a dream event is followed by a real-life event that's similar to it, especially if the subject of the dream is something that happens often in everyday life.
simplified:
Most people have dreams every night.
After they are ten years old, they have four to six dreams.
That is about 2,000 dreams every year.
So, when a person is 80 years old, they have had many dreams.
Maybe 140,000 dreams in their life.
We forget most of our dreams.
We forget 95 to 99 of every 100 dreams.
But we still remember a few thousand dreams.
Sometimes, we have a dream.
Then, something similar happens in real life.
This is probably just by chance.
This happens more when the dream is about normal things.
These are things that happen every day.

It's not too difficult to believe that, by coincidence, a dream event is followed by a real-life event that's similar to it, especially if the subject of the dream is something that happens often in everyday life.

So, by the time an average person reaches the age of 80, they might have had 140,000 dreams. Even though we forget 95 to 99 per cent of our dreams, we still recall a few thousand of them in a lifetime. For this reason, it is understandable that a dream can be followed by a similar real-life event, just by coincidence, especially if the dream is about something that occurs frequently in everyday life.

original: The Hunger Games takes place in the future, after the destruction of North America. The country is called Panem and is made up of twelve poor districts governed by the wealthy Capitol. The Capitol holds absolute power over the nation. Each district is responsible for producing different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story begins, provides all the coal for the country. There used to be a thirteenth district but they rebelled against the Capitol in the past and were destroyed.
simplified:
The Hunger Games is a story about the future. In the story, North America is gone. The new country's name is Panem.

A district is a part of a country. Panem has twelve poor districts. The Capitol is the name of the rich city that rules the country. The Capitol has all the power.

Each district makes different things for the Capitol. The story starts in District 12. This district makes all the coal for the country. Coal is a black rock used for energy.

In the past, there was another district. It was District 13. The people of District 13 fought against the Capitol. So the Capitol destroyed it.

original: Another suggested defence against a PHA on course to hit Earth is to blow it up using a nuclear weapon. It may sound like a plot from a film, and it was the subject of the 1998 film Armageddon, but the Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER) is a genuine NASA proposal. The eight-ton rockets would be fired at an approaching asteroid with the hope of bumping it off course. If the asteroid was too close to Earth for this plan to work, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to blow it up instead.
simplified:
An asteroid is a big rock in space.

There is another idea to protect Earth. An asteroid could hit our planet. The idea is to use a special, very strong bomb. This bomb can blow up the asteroid. This sounds like an idea from a movie. The movie Armageddon was about this.

But it is a real idea from NASA. It is a plan with a long name. The name is Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER). They would send eight-ton rockets to the asteroid. They hope to hit the asteroid. This will push it onto a new path.

But sometimes the asteroid is very near Earth. Then this plan will not work. So the rockets will carry special, very strong bombs. They will use these bombs to blow up the asteroid.

original: Underutilised items may seem useless to some, but could be an asset to others. With the advent of the internet, online communities have figured out a way to generate profit from the sharing of those underused assets. Using websites and social media groups that facilitate the buying and selling of second-hand goods, it is now easier than ever for peer-to-peer sharing activities to take place. And this is known as the sharing economy.
simplified:
Some people have things they do not use very much. These things may seem useless to them. But these things can be useful for other people.

The internet helps people make money from these things. People use websites and social media groups. They sell or rent their things to other people. This makes it easy for people to share with each other.

This is called the **sharing economy**. The **sharing economy** is a system where people make money. They share things they own with others using the internet.

original: Around the 18th and 19th centuries two main ideas about dreams became popular. One was the idea that the things we see in our dreams represent things hidden from our conscious mind. Freud believed that if we understand what dreams are telling us, we can understand our hidden feelings and the problems they cause. However, the other theory was the opposite. It said that dreams are just a collection of random activity in the brain while it's organising memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings and put them into some sort of story.
simplified:
In the 18th and 19th centuries, there were two main ideas about dreams.
One idea said dreams show us secret things. These are things we do not know about. A man named Freud had this idea. He said our dreams tell us things. If we understand our dreams, we can understand our secret feelings. We can also understand our problems.
But the other idea was very different. It said dreams are just brain activity. This activity is not planned. The brain does this when it puts memories in order. These are memories from the day.
When we wake up, we remember pictures and feelings. These pictures and feelings have no reason. We try to understand them. So we make a story about them.

It said that dreams are just a collection of random activity in the brain while it's organising memories and events from the day. simplified:
Around the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that the things we see in our dreams represent feelings that are hidden from our normal, awake mind. Freud had an idea about this. He believed that if we understand our dreams, we can understand these hidden feelings and the problems they cause.

However, the other theory was the opposite. It said that dreams are just a collection of activity without a pattern in the brain. This happens while the brain organizes memories from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these unplanned images and feelings, so we put them together into a story.

original: I'm a freelancer and work for myself. This is great because I am in control of what I do and how I spend my time. At first, I was working from home, but I found it really hard to concentrate. There were just too many distractions around: housework that needed doing, another cup of tea, my family members wanting my attention for various things. So I started to go to a nearby café to work, but the Wi-Fi connection wasn't ideal and I found myself drinking too much coffee. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers like myself. I liked getting dressed to go to work in the morning and being able to focus in an office environment.
simplified:
A freelancer is a person who works for themselves. I am a freelancer.

This is great. I can decide what I do. I can also decide how I use my time. First, I worked at home. But it was very hard to focus. Many things stopped me from working. I had to clean the house. I wanted to drink more tea. And my family wanted to talk to me.

So I went to a café near my home. But the Wi-Fi was not good. And I drank too much coffee.

In the end, I rented a desk in a special office. It is a co-working space. Five other freelancers work there too. I like it. I get dressed in the morning to go to work. I can focus in a place like an office.

If NASA gets the money, it will take about ten years. After they find the asteroids, a team has a job. They must think about how to protect our planet. They need to stop dangerous asteroids from hitting it.

original: The 'buy nothing' trend has now reached influencers on social media who usually share posts of clothing and make-up that they recommend for people to buy. Some YouTube stars now encourage their viewers not to buy anything at all for periods as long as a year. Two friends in Canada spent a year working towards buying only food. For the first three months they learned how to live without buying electrical goods, clothes or things for the house. For the next stage, they gave up services, for example haircuts, eating out at restaurants or buying petrol for their cars. In one year, they'd saved $55,000.
simplified:
There is a new idea called 'buy nothing'.
This idea is now on social media.
Some people on social media are influencers.
They usually share pictures of clothes and make-up.
They tell people to buy these things.

But now, some YouTube stars say something different.
They tell people not to buy anything.
They say to do this for a long time, like one year.

Two friends in Canada tried this for a year.
They only bought food.
For the first three months, they stopped buying some things.
They did not buy things that use electricity, clothes, or things for the house.

Next, they stopped paying for services.
For example, they did not get haircuts.
They did not eat in restaurants.
They did not buy gas for their cars.
In one year, they saved $55,000.

original: Some people think writing your dreams down can open your mind to lucid dreaming. Lucid dreams are dreams where you're not only aware you're dreaming but you can make decisions to affect the events of your dreams. So, maybe you can turn a nightmare into a safe-feeling dream, or you can direct the plot of your dream like a film director. Then, instead of just working out the meaning of your dreams, you'll be creating them, though you might want to continue having some dreams that allow your subconscious to tell you what's on your mind!
simplified:
Some people write their dreams down. They think this helps them have a lucid dream.

A lucid dream is a special dream. In a lucid dream, you know you are dreaming. You can also make choices to change the dream.

So, you can change a bad dream. You can make it a nice dream. Or you can control the story of your dream. You are like a film director.

You are not just understanding your dreams. You are making them. But maybe you still want to have some normal dreams. These dreams can show you what you are thinking about.

original: Some people think writing your dreams down can open your mind to lucid dreaming. Lucid dreams are dreams where you're not only aware you're dreaming but you can make decisions to affect the events of your dreams. So, maybe you can turn a nightmare into a safe-feeling dream, or you can direct the plot of your dream like a film director. Then, instead of just working out the meaning of your dreams, you'll be creating them, though you might want to continue having some dreams that allow your subconscious to tell you what's on your mind!
simplified: Some people think that writing your dreams down can help you have lucid dreams, which are dreams where you are not only aware that you are dreaming, but you can also make decisions to change what happens. For example, you could turn a nightmare into a dream that feels safe, or you could control the story of your dream like a film director. This means that instead of just trying to understand the meaning of your dreams, you will be creating them. However, you might still want to have some normal dreams, because they can allow your mind to show you what you are really thinking about.

original: People might not realise they are part of the disposable clothing problem because they donate their unwanted clothes to charities. But charity shops can't sell all those unwanted clothes. 'Fast fashion' goes out of fashion as quickly as it came in and is often too poor quality to recycle; people don't want to buy it second-hand. Huge quantities end up being thrown away, and a lot of clothes that charities can't sell are sent abroad, causing even more economic and environmental problems.
simplified:
Fast fashion is when companies make new clothes very quickly and cheaply. The style changes all the time.

People give clothes they do not want to charity shops. They might not know this is part of a problem with disposable clothes. These are clothes that people throw away quickly. But charity shops cannot sell all these clothes. This is because of fast fashion.

The clothes go out of fashion very fast. Their quality is often very poor. So people do not want to buy them second-hand. You also cannot recycle them.

So, huge quantities of clothes are thrown away. Charities also send clothes they cannot sell to other countries. This causes more economic and environmental problems.

original: People might not realise they are part of the disposable clothing problem because they donate their unwanted clothes to charities. But charity shops can't sell all those unwanted clothes. 'Fast fashion' goes out of fashion as quickly as it came in and is often too poor quality to recycle; people don't want to buy it second-hand. Huge quantities end up being thrown away, and a lot of clothes that charities can't sell are sent abroad, causing even more economic and environmental problems.
simplified: People might not realise they are part of the problem with throw-away clothing, because they often donate the clothes they don't want anymore to charities. However, charity shops are not able to sell all of these clothes. **Fast fashion, which is cheap clothing that is made and sold very quickly,** goes out of fashion as fast as it became popular, and its quality is often too poor for it to be recycled or for people to want to buy it second-hand. Because of this, huge amounts of clothes end up being thrown away. In addition, many of the clothes that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries, which causes even more economic and environmental problems there.

original: Not content with one amazing trip, some of today's adventurers go from challenge to challenge. Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, ridden a bike across Canada and run a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert in 45ºC heat. But perhaps her most remarkable journey was a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and had to be rescued. Many of us would have given up at that point, but Meagan decided to carry on. She reached the South Pole forty days later, having pulled a sledge with a tent and all her food behind her through freezing conditions and ice storms.
simplified:
Some people always want to do something new and difficult. One difficult trip is not enough for them. Meagan McGrath from Canada is one of these people.

She climbed the highest mountain on every continent. She rode a bike across Canada. She also ran a very long race in the Sahara Desert. The weather was very hot at 45ºC.

But her most amazing trip was to the South Pole. She went there on skis. On the first day, she had a big problem. She fell into a big river of ice. Someone had to save her.

Many people would stop after that. But Meagan did not stop. She decided to continue. She arrived at the South Pole forty days later. She pulled a sled with her tent and all her food. The weather was very cold with bad ice storms.

She likes that her street art does not stay for a long time. Soon, the weather will wash it away. Or people who work for the city will clean it. She thinks this is like life. Life is always changing. Old things end and new things start.

original: In her previous work environment, Gabriela was used to a high power distance culture where power and authority are respected and everyone has their rightful place. In such a culture, leaders make the big decisions and are not often challenged. Her Swedish team, however, were used to working in a low power distance culture where subordinates often work together with their bosses to find solutions and make decisions. Here, leaders act as coaches or mentors who encourage independent thought and expect to be challenged.

At her old job, Gabriela worked in a high power distance culture. In this culture, workers respected their leaders. Leaders had a lot of power and made the big decisions. Workers did not often question them.

Leaders are like coaches. They want workers to think for themselves. They think it is good when workers question their ideas.

Here, leaders act like coaches who encourage their team to think for themselves and expect to be challenged.

original: Dogs that live in packs have learnt that humans are more likely to give food to smaller, cuter dogs so those dogs are sent to beg for food for the whole pack. original: In Britain, the average person spends more than £1,000 on new clothes a year, which is around four per cent of their income. That might not sound like much, but that figure hides two far more worrying trends for society and for the environment. First, a lot of that consumer spending is via credit cards. British people currently owe approximately £670 per adult to credit card companies. That's 66 per cent of the average wardrobe budget. Also, not only are people spending money they don't have, they're using it to buy things they don't need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing a year, most of which goes into landfill sites.

Every year, Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing, and most of it goes into landfill sites.

original: Businesses have caught on to the profitability of the sharing economy and are seeking to gain from making use of those underutilised resources. A business model that has rapidly risen in popularity sees companies providing an online platform that puts customers in contact with those who can provide a particular product or service. Companies like Airbnb act as a middleman for people to cash in on their unused rooms and houses and let them out as lucrative accommodation. Another example is Uber, which encourages people to use their own personal cars as taxis to make some extra cash in their free time.
simplified:
The sharing economy is a business idea. People can make money from things they own but do not always use. Businesses know this is a good way to make money.

A new business model is now very popular. Companies create an online platform. This is a website or an app. The platform acts as a middleman. It connects people who have something with people who want to use it.

For example, Airbnb is a company like this. It connects people with empty rooms to people who need a place to stay. The owners can make a lot of money from their unused rooms.

Uber is another example. It encourages people to use their own cars like taxis. They can make extra money when they have free time.

Another example is Uber, which helps people use their own personal cars as taxis so they can earn extra money in their free time.

original: One of the most important modern functions of zoos is supporting international breeding programmes, particularly for endangered species. In the wild, some of the rarest species have difficulty in finding mates and breeding, and they might also be threatened by poachers, loss of their habitat and predators. A good zoo will enable these species to live and breed in a secure environment. In addition, as numbers of some wild species drop, there is an increased danger of populations becoming too genetically similar. Breeding programmes provide a safeguard: zoo-bred animals can be released into the wild to increase genetic diversity.
simplified:
A species is a type of animal. Some species are in danger.
Breeding programmes are special plans. Countries work together on them. The plans help animals have babies.

Zoos have a very important job today. They help with international breeding programmes. This is for species that are in danger.

In nature, these animals have problems. It is hard for them to find a partner and have babies. People might catch and kill them. They can lose their homes. And other animals can kill them.

A good zoo gives these animals a safe place. They can live and have babies in the zoo.

There is another problem. Sometimes there are not many animals of one species. It is not good if all the animals are from the same family. This is not healthy for the species.

Breeding programmes protect the future of these animals. Animals from zoos can go back to live in nature. They bring new animals to a group. Then, the animals in the group are not all the same. This helps the species to be strong and healthy.

Breeding programmes provide a safeguard: zoo-bred animals can be released into the wild to increase genetic diversity.
simplified: Today, one of the most important jobs of zoos is to help with international breeding programmes, especially for species that are in danger of disappearing forever. A good zoo allows these species to live and have babies in a safe place. Also, when the number of some wild animals drops, there is a danger that the groups become too similar. Breeding programmes offer protection from this, because animals born in zoos can be set free in the wild to increase **genetic diversity**, which is the variety of different family types within a group of animals that helps to keep them healthy.

original: Both of these kinds of accidents are extremely rare, but boats and trains can cause a bridge to collapse for different reasons. With trains, it's the velocity of the impact that can bring a bridge down. With boats, it's the very large mass they have that can bring about the collapse, even if they are moving very slowly when it occurs. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technologies that can detect structural weakness, safer working environments and better designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.

Boats and trains can make a bridge fall down. These accidents almost never happen. They happen for different reasons.

A train can make a bridge fall. This happens because the train hits it very fast. A boat can also make a bridge fall. This is because boats have a very large mass. It can happen even if the boat is moving slowly.

We can make bridges safer. We need to plan for these problems. New technology can find weak parts of a bridge. Safer places to work also help. And better bridge designs help too. These things can help. Then, there will be fewer bad accidents.

It is also the first book for young readers that has sold more than a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games has now been made into a major Hollywood film that is just as successful, making 152.5 million dollars in North America alone during its opening weekend.

original: Maybe dreams are the result of our mind organising the thoughts we have during the day, but they appear in dreams with symbolic meaning. When we're awake, our thoughts mostly appear in our minds as words, like conversations we have with ourselves. But when we're asleep, the part of our brain that controls language becomes less active while the part that controls emotions becomes more active.
simplified:
Maybe dreams happen for a reason.
Our mind puts our thoughts from the day in order.
But in dreams, these thoughts have a special meaning.
When we are not sleeping, we think with words.
It is like we talk to ourselves in our head.
But when we are sleeping, our brain changes.
One part of our brain is for words.
This part works less when we sleep.
Another part of our brain is for feelings.
This part works more.

When we're awake, our thoughts mostly appear in our minds as words, like conversations we have with ourselves. But when we're asleep, the part of our brain that controls language becomes less active while the part that controls emotions becomes more active.
simplified: Perhaps dreams happen because our mind is organising the thoughts we have during the day, but in our dreams these thoughts appear with a symbolic meaning. When we are awake, our thoughts are usually in the form of words, like conversations that we have with ourselves. However, when we are asleep, the part of our brain which controls language becomes less active. At the same time, the part that controls our emotions becomes more active.

original: Having good relationships is a big part of being happy. In one study, most happy people were found to have strong ties to friends and family and they made sure they spent time with them regularly. You also need at least one person who you discuss personal feelings with – called 'self-disclosure'. Just one person for a heart-to-heart is enough, together with a network of other relationships. It's not enough to have lots of friends just to do things with or chat to about music or football. That deeper connection is all-important. Some people need to learn how to listen effectively to others in order to develop stronger relationships.
simplified:
Good relationships are very important to be happy.
One study looked at happy people.
It found they have strong relationships with friends and family.
They spend time with them often.
Self-disclosure is when you talk about your personal feelings with someone.
You need to have at least one person for self-disclosure.
One person for a deep talk is enough.
You also need other friends.
It is not enough to have many friends just for fun.
You can do things with them or talk about music.
But a strong relationship is very important.
Some people need to learn to listen well.
This helps them make their relationships stronger.

original: Having good relationships is a big part of being happy. In one study, most happy people were found to have strong ties to friends and family and they made sure they spent time with them regularly. You also need at least one person who you discuss personal feelings with – called 'self-disclosure'. Just one person for a heart-to-heart is enough, together with a network of other relationships. It's not enough to have lots of friends just to do things with or chat to about music or football. That deeper connection is all-important. Some people need to learn how to listen effectively to others in order to develop stronger relationships.
simplified: Having good relationships is a very important part of being happy. One study found that most happy people have strong connections with friends and family, and they make sure to spend time with them regularly. You also need at least one person who you can discuss your personal feelings with. This is called 'self-disclosure', which is when you share your private thoughts with someone. Having just one person for this kind of deep conversation is enough, as long as you also have a group of other relationships. It is not enough to have lots of friends if you only do activities with them or chat about things like music or football, because that deeper connection is the most important thing. In order to develop stronger relationships, some people need to learn how to listen to others effectively.

original: Psychologist and 'growth mindset' proponent Carol Dweck spoke of the plasticity of the brain and our ability to develop skills and talents that we might not have been good at to start with. Many of us tend to focus our praise on the end result and seemingly innate talents, e.g. 'You really have an eye for details' or 'You have a real talent for organising events'. However, research suggests that by focusing on the process of how things are done – praising effort, experimentation and problem-solving strategies – we can encourage the development of new skills and the continued honing of talents.
simplified:
Carol Dweck is a person. She studies how people think. She talks about an idea called a "growth mindset". A growth mindset is a way of thinking. This idea is that you believe you can learn and get better. She says our brains can change. We can learn new skills, even if we are not good at them at first.

Many of us praise the final result. Or we praise natural talents. For example, we say "You are very good with details." Or "You are very good at making plans for things."

But studies show there is a better way. We should praise how people do something. We should praise their effort. We should also praise their experiments and their ways of finding answers. This helps people learn new skills. And it helps them get better at their talents.

original: Psychologist and 'growth mindset' proponent Carol Dweck spoke of the plasticity of the brain and our ability to develop skills and talents that we might not have been good at to start with. Many of us tend to focus our praise on the end result and seemingly innate talents, e.g. 'You really have an eye for details' or 'You have a real talent for organising events'. However, research suggests that by focusing on the process of how things are done – praising effort, experimentation and problem-solving strategies – we can encourage the development of new skills and the continued honing of talents.
simplified: Psychologist Carol Dweck supports the idea of a **growth mindset**, which is the belief that you can develop your abilities. She explained that the brain can change, so we have the ability to learn skills and talents, even if we were not good at them at first. Many of us tend to praise the final result or natural talents that people seem to have. For example, we might say, 'You are really good with details' or 'You have a real talent for organising events'. However, research shows that it is better to focus on the process of how things are done. If we praise people's effort, their way of trying new things, and the methods they use to solve problems, we can encourage them to develop new skills and continue to improve their talents.

original: The rover analyses the air around it periodically, and in 2014 it found the air contained another of the most basic organic molecules and a key ingredient of natural gas: methane. One of the characteristics of methane is that it only survives a few hundred years. This means that something, somewhere on Mars, is replenishing the supply. According to NASA, Mars emits thousands of tons of methane at a time. The level of methane rises and falls at seasonal intervals in the year, almost as if the planet is breathing it.
simplified:
Methane is a type of gas. It is an important part of natural gas.

A machine on Mars studies the air. In 2014, it found methane in the air. Methane does not last for a long time. It only lasts for a few hundred years. So, something on Mars is making more.

NASA says Mars makes a lot of methane. The amount of methane changes with the seasons. It goes up and down. It is like the planet is breathing.

original: The rover analyses the air around it periodically, and in 2014 it found the air contained another of the most basic organic molecules and a key ingredient of natural gas: methane. One of the characteristics of methane is that it only survives a few hundred years. This means that something, somewhere on Mars, is replenishing the supply. According to NASA, Mars emits thousands of tons of methane at a time. The level of methane rises and falls at seasonal intervals in the year, almost as if the planet is breathing it.
simplified: The rover regularly studies the air around it, and in 2014 it found methane, which is a basic organic molecule and an important part of natural gas. One feature of methane is that it only survives for a few hundred years, which means that something, somewhere on Mars, is creating a new supply of it. According to NASA, Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at a time, and the level of it rises and falls with the seasons, almost as if the planet is breathing it.

original: Early in her career, the psychologist Carol Dweck of Stanford University gave a group of ten-year-olds problems that were slightly too hard for them. One group reacted positively, said they loved challenge and understood that their abilities could be developed. She says they had a 'growth mindset' and are focused on what they can achieve in the future. But another group of children felt that their intelligence was being judged and they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and were unable to imagine improving. Some of these children said they might cheat in the future; others looked for someone who had done worse than them to boost their self-esteem.
simplified:
A mindset is the way you think about things.

Carol Dweck is a person who studies how people think. She did a study with ten-year-old children. She gave them some problems. The problems were a little too hard for them.

One group of children was happy with the hard problems. They understood their skills could grow. Carol Dweck says these children had a 'growth mindset'. They think about what they can do in the future.

But another group of children felt bad. They felt someone was testing if they were smart. They felt they had failed. These children had a 'fixed mindset'. They thought it was not possible to get better.

Some of these children said they might not follow the rules in the future. Other children looked for someone who did a worse job. This was because they wanted to feel better about themselves.

original: Early in her career, the psychologist Carol Dweck of Stanford University gave a group of ten-year-olds problems that were slightly too hard for them. One group reacted positively, said they loved challenge and understood that their abilities could be developed. She says they had a 'growth mindset' and are focused on what they can achieve in the future. But another group of children felt that their intelligence was being judged and they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and were unable to imagine improving. Some of these children said they might cheat in the future; others looked for someone who had done worse than them to boost their self-esteem.
simplified: Early in her career, the researcher Carol Dweck gave a group of ten-year-olds problems that were a little too hard for them. One group of children reacted in a positive way, because they said they loved a challenge and understood that their skills could be improved. She says they had a 'growth mindset', which is a way of thinking where people focus on what they can achieve in the future. However, another group of children felt that their intelligence was being tested and that they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset', which is a way of thinking that made them unable to imagine getting better. Some of these children said they might cheat in the future, while others looked for someone who had done worse than them to make themselves feel better.

original: Horror films love uninhabited places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary too. Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's more believable that you will have no phone coverage there either.
simplified:
Horror films often use empty places.
For example, an old hospital.
Or a scary, empty house.
Or a town with no people.
These empty places are very scary.
You think about the past.
What was it like when people lived there?
Why did they go away?
These places are also very quiet.
This can be scary too.
Empty places are also good for film makers.
It is easy to believe your phone will not work there.

original: Horror films love uninhabited places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary too. Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's more believable that you will have no phone coverage there either.
simplified: Horror films often use places where no one lives, such as an empty hospital, a scary house, or a ghost town. There is something scary about these lonely places because they make you wonder what it was like when people lived there and why they left. Maybe it is also because they are so quiet, which can be very scary too. Of course, these empty places are also useful for film directors, as it is more believable that you will not have a phone signal there.

original: No matter what kind of house it is, the basement is a scary place in horror films. That's usually where something is hiding or where the evil psychopath has hidden their tools. Basements are always dark and often damp. You can only reach them by a narrow staircase. And basements are always creepy, even when there isn't anything down there.

In scary movies, the basement is a scary place.

Or a very bad person keeps his tools there.
Basements are always dark.
They are often wet.
You can only go there using small stairs.
And basements are always scary.
This is true even when nothing is there.

original: Gary Collins, an off-duty policeman, was watching the London riots on TV. He immediately recognised several people and cut his holiday short to help with identification. He ended up spending six months going through the CCTV film and managed to identify 190 people, many from their eyes alone. His help was of decisive importance in the investigation. Even with 200,000 hours of footage, facial recognition software managed to identify just one person.
simplified:
Gary Collins is a policeman. One day, he was not working. He was at home watching TV. He saw news about riots in London.

Gary knew some of the people on the TV. He was on holiday, but he stopped his holiday early. He wanted to help the other police. He helped them find the names of the people.

For six months, he watched camera videos. He found and named 190 people. Sometimes, he only saw their eyes. His help was very, very important.

The police had 200,000 hours of video. They used a computer program to find faces. But the computer only found one person.

original: Gary Collins, an off-duty policeman, was watching the London riots on TV. He immediately recognised several people and cut his holiday short to help with identification. He ended up spending six months going through the CCTV film and managed to identify 190 people, many from their eyes alone. His help was of decisive importance in the investigation. Even with 200,000 hours of footage, facial recognition software managed to identify just one person.
simplified: Gary Collins, a policeman who was on holiday, was watching the London riots on television when he recognised several people. He immediately decided to end his holiday early so he could help the police identify them. He then spent six months carefully watching CCTV video, and he was able to identify 190 people, often just by looking at their eyes. His help was extremely important for the police work, especially because special computer software only managed to identify one person, even though it checked 200,000 hours of video.

original: Personally, I think it's fascinating to consider how we'll speed up our evolution as a species by augmenting our bodies. Imagine if you could implant a computer inside our brain! Soon we'll be able to do just that and enhance our mathematical ability, audiovisual perception and our memory, and this idea is only going to become more and more commonplace.
simplified:
I think it is interesting to think about our future.
We can help people to change and develop faster.
We can do this by adding technology to our bodies.
This will improve us in many ways.
For example, we can put a computer in our brain.
Soon, we will be able to do this.
A computer in our brain can help us.
It can improve our ability with numbers.
It can make us see and hear better.
It can also make our memory stronger.
In the future, this idea will be very common.

original: Personally, I think it's fascinating to consider how we'll speed up our evolution as a species by augmenting our bodies. Imagine if you could implant a computer inside our brain! Soon we'll be able to do just that and enhance our mathematical ability, audiovisual perception and our memory, and this idea is only going to become more and more commonplace.
simplified: I think it is a fascinating idea that we could speed up the way humans develop by adding technology to our bodies. For example, imagine if you could put a computer inside your brain. Soon, we will be able to do exactly that, which would help us improve our ability with numbers, the way we see and hear, and our memory. I believe this idea is going to become much more common in the future.

original: It was a fascinating talk and the speaker really hit the nail on the head with a couple of things. Take parental influence, for instance. How can we expect teenagers not to text while doing their homework when they witness their parents posting on social media while cooking the evening meal or waiting at a red light? She also made a valid point about people wanting to be in two or several places at once. So they switch back and forth between their real-life and online conversations. I see it all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends. They arrange to meet and then sit together in silence while each one engages in a different conversation online.
simplified:
The talk was very interesting. The speaker said some true things. For example, she talked about parents. She talked about what children learn from them.

Teenagers see their parents do things. They see them use social media when they cook. Or they see them use it at a red light. So, teenagers also text when they do their homework. We cannot be surprised by this.

She also said another true thing. People want to be in many places at the same time. So they change between talking in real life and talking online. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They plan to meet. Then they sit together. But they do not talk. Each person talks to someone different online.

original: It was a fascinating talk and the speaker really hit the nail on the head with a couple of things. Take parental influence, for instance. How can we expect teenagers not to text while doing their homework when they witness their parents posting on social media while cooking the evening meal or waiting at a red light? She also made a valid point about people wanting to be in two or several places at once. So they switch back and forth between their real-life and online conversations. I see it all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends. They arrange to meet and then sit together in silence while each one engages in a different conversation online.
simplified: It was a fascinating talk, and the speaker said a couple of things that were exactly right. For example, she talked about the influence of parents. How can we expect teenagers not to text while they are doing their homework, when they see their parents posting on social media while cooking dinner or waiting at a red light? She also made a good point about how people want to be in several places at the same time, so they change between their real-life and online conversations. I see this all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends. They arrange to meet up, but then they sit together without talking while each person has a different conversation online.

original: As for news stories that make us think the world is an increasingly violent place, there is cause for some optimism too. Between the end of World War II and 1990, there were 30 wars that killed more than 100,000 people. Today there are still civil wars, but countries are mostly co-existing more peacefully than in the past. However, terrorism has shot up in the last few years and, since World War II, wars have killed many more civilians than soldiers. Even for civilians, though, the statistics are not all bad. Although deaths are nine times more likely to be a result of violent crime than political conflict, the global murder rate fell slightly, from 8 per 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.
simplified:
Some news makes us think the world is a bad place with a lot of war. But there is some good news too.
From 1945 to 1990, there were 30 big wars. These wars killed more than 100,000 people each. Today, there are still wars inside some countries. But countries now live together more peacefully.
But there are more attacks on normal people now. These attacks are to make people afraid. And wars kill many normal people. They kill more normal people than soldiers.
But the numbers for normal people are not all bad. More people die from crime than from political problems. The number of deaths from crime is nine times bigger. But the number of murders in the world went down. In the year 2000, 8 people in 100,000 were killed. In 2015, about 5.3 people in 100,000 were killed.

original: As for news stories that make us think the world is an increasingly violent place, there is cause for some optimism too. Today there are still civil wars, but countries are mostly co-existing more peacefully than in the past. However, terrorism has shot up in the last few years and, since World War II, wars have killed many more civilians than soldiers. Even for civilians, though, the statistics are not all bad. Although deaths are nine times more likely to be a result of violent crime than political conflict, the global murder rate fell slightly, from 8 per 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.
simplified: Although news stories often make us think the world is becoming a more violent place, there is also some reason to be hopeful. Between the end of World War II and 1990, there were 30 wars which killed more than 100,000 people. Today, there are still wars inside some countries, but nations are mostly living together more peacefully than in the past. However, terrorism has increased a lot in the last few years, and since World War II, wars have killed many more civilians (people who are not soldiers) than soldiers. Even for civilians, though, the numbers are not all bad. Although deaths from violent crime are nine times more likely than deaths from political conflict, the number of murders around the world fell a little, from 8 for every 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

original: Wasfia has dedicated her life to supporting human rights and has witnessed numerous international humanitarian projects in her homeland to educate and train women and girls, but once too often they have been left with nothing when such projects have stopped running. Wasfia saw that Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself and so she brought together two of her passions, mountaineering and human rights, in order to try and change attitudes towards women in her country. She originally took up climbing while working on humanitarian campaigns in Tibet and Nepal, as in a coastal, primarily flat country like Bangladesh most people have never set eyes on a mountain. Her campaign seems to be doing the trick as fellow countrymen and women are sitting up and taking notice along with the rest of the world.
simplified:
Wasfia works hard to support human rights in her country. Human rights are important. Every person should have them. For example, every person should be safe and free.
She saw projects from other countries come to help women and girls. But these projects often stopped. When the projects stopped, the women had nothing. This showed Wasfia a big problem. She knew Bangladesh needed to help itself. So she brought her two passions together to make a change. She loved climbing mountains and human rights. She wanted to change how people think about women.
She started climbing when she was working on projects in Tibet and Nepal. Her country, Bangladesh, is very flat and near the sea. Most people there have never seen a mountain.
So climbing gets people's attention. Her idea is working. People in Bangladesh are paying attention. And people in other countries are paying attention too.

original: Wasfia has dedicated her life to supporting human rights and has witnessed numerous international humanitarian projects in her homeland to educate and train women and girls, but once too often they have been left with nothing when such projects have stopped running. Wasfia saw that Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself and so she brought together two of her passions, mountaineering and human rights, in order to try and change attitudes towards women in her country. She originally took up climbing while working on humanitarian campaigns in Tibet and Nepal, as in a coastal, primarily flat country like Bangladesh most people have never set eyes on a mountain. Her campaign seems to be doing the trick as fellow countrymen and women are sitting up and taking notice along with the rest of the world.
simplified:
Wasfia has given her life to supporting human rights, and she has seen many international projects in her home country that tried to educate and train women and girls. However, she noticed that when these projects ended, the women were often left with nothing. Wasfia believed that Bangladesh needed to help itself, so she combined two of her passions: mountaineering, which is the sport of climbing mountains, and human rights. She did this to try and change the way people think about women in her country.

She first started climbing when she was working on projects to help people in Tibet and Nepal. This was unusual because Bangladesh is a mostly flat country near the sea, so most people there have never seen a mountain. Her campaign seems to be working, as other people from her country are now paying attention, along with the rest of the world.

original: The majority of people believe that developing countries are in a terrible situation: suffering from incredible poverty, governed by dictators and with little hope for any meaningful change. But, surprisingly, this is far from the truth. The reality is that a great transformation is occurring. Over the past 20 years, more than 700 million people have increased their income and come out of poverty. Additionally, six million fewer children die every year from disease, millions more girls are in school and millions of people have access to clean water.
simplified:
Most people think poor countries are in a very bad situation. They believe the people are very poor. They think the countries have bad leaders. And they think there is no hope for a good change.

But this is not true. A big change is happening now. In the last 20 years, many things got better. More than 700 million people have more money. They are not poor anymore.

Also, six million fewer children die from sickness every year. Millions more girls are in school. And millions of people can get clean water.
